Fields.DialogueText: We've got Morganas incoming!
@BATTLE
That's right boys! Pour it on! Brujah ain't about to cope with all this coming at'em.
You're in good spirits today.
Aw, Cap, you know I love it when a plan comes together. I'll admit, you throw out some good ones for combined fleet actions now and then.
I'll take that in the spirit it was intended, Houston, thank you. XO!
Captain?
Secure from general quarters. I want the damage report on my desk yesterday.
Aye-aye, Captain. Bosun! Secure general quarters!
Houston, a word?
Of course, Cap'n.
*HATCH SHUT*
Not often you need a word in private right after a fight.
Something came off the wireless before we engaged. I didn't have time to grab you beforehand.
You're looking mighty serious. Tell me what's up afore I get nervous.
Command thinks you might have made some enemies after your dealings with Sabotage.
I don't know the details, but intelligence suggested that we might find other Morganas on our tail in the coming days, these ones intending on revenge.
Hah! Is that all? Damn witches ain't gonna learn from one licking, I see.

Fields.MenuText: I wish you'd take this a bit more seriously. The Morganas are probably wise to our old tricks.
Come on, Houston, be reasonable. Sure, we'll string them up, but we gotta stay on our toes.
Well, considering how we handled them last time...

Fields.DialogueText: Then we'll come up with new tricks. Ease up, Cap.
It'll be all right, Cap. Brujah ain't come up with a trick that can catch me yet.
Damn right, Cap'n. They wanna come, let'em. They'll get more of the same.
While we're here, one sec...
Have you always had beer hidden behind that panel?
Just since you and me found ourselves getting on more and you moved your flag over. There's one for you, Cap, some of my personal stash.
Well then, here's to going witch hunting.
Here, here, Cap!
All right, I think that this paperwork is squared away.
Cap, you've been working too long.
From your lips to God's ear, Houston. What's that glorious smell?
I brought you some vittles before the mess ran dry of BBQ. We got some actual beef in for once.
That sounds too good to be... Hmmm. All right, what's your angle?
I'm just trying to be hospitable to my captain. You work so hard for me n' the crew, after all.
... buuuut maybe there is a little budget item I was hoping to ask you about.
I knew it...
Aww, hold your horses, Cap. It's this sheet of supplies here. I wanna make sure we're ready to rumble when the Brujah show up.
So you are taking this threat seriously.
Cap, this Brujah's seeking me out personally. Threatening you, my crew, and myself. I can't be taking that kinda lip. I have a reputation to think of!

Fields.MenuText: Hah, well, no one can fault your spirit, that's for damn sure.
Oh? What's your reputation?
Let's not bother preserving your reputation when we can make it even better instead.

Fields.DialogueText: Damn right they can't.
Now you're just joshing me, Cap. You know I'm one of the most adventurous Belles to sail these waters.
Hah, just you watch me, Cap'n!
*ALARM*
Well, let's see what we can do for your reputation now.
@BATTLE
Enemy incoming from the south!
@BATTLE
Get outta here, you mangy mutts!
Phew, that was a little tight there at the end.
Aw, Cap, ya gotta have a little faith in your favorite cowgirl. I'll beat these Brujah with only my fine self here.
Captain! Masts on the horizon!
I have a bad feeling about this for some reason...
Aw hell... incoming!
Brace!
*BOOM*
Damage report!
I'm hella furious, that's the damage!
Captain, I don't have response from the rudder. I think they've disabled us!

Fields.MenuText: Well it's just a regular party today isn't it?
Houston, I need options.
This isn't good, we're overexposed. Get those guns firing!

Fields.DialogueText: Aww shucks, well let's show these rascals a good time then.
Working on it, Cap...
We're gonna have words about that dig, ya hear? Firing!
Captain, the rest of the fleet is inbound.
All right, keep firing! Once the Morganas are gone, tell them we might need a tow if we can't wrangle this rudder back into shape.
Captain, I have a bone to pick with you, right the hell now.
Hello, Houston, good to see you. Come in and have a seat. Would you like some coffee?
Now you're just mocking me!
I'm trying to throw you off your stride. Now have a seat and tell me what's upsetting you.
It's these repairs! I need to get back out there Cap.
Hold up, Houston. I need you in fighting shape. I can't have my flagship shot out from under me because of incomplete maintenance. Think of our reputations.
My reputation's smarting plenty as is, hon. Get me back out there so I can kick these Brujah's butts!
I'll admit I haven't seen you this angry before.
I ain't about to get pissed, Cap'n. I'mma get even instead!

Fields.MenuText: You don't need to get mad. You're already seething.
If you want to do that best, you'll let the crews finish their repairs.
Why are you taking this so personally? We overextended and caught a volley, it happens.

Fields.DialogueText: I'mma be irritated with you if you keep this up, Cap. I like ya, think you're a good boss for sure, but you let me have this, ya hear?
Hmph. Fine... not like I got much choice. Though rudder's all back together.
I overextended. I made that call, and the Brujah hit us for it! Hurt me, hurt my sailors, coulda hurt y'all too. I ain't taking that laying down, Cap.
You're an experienced hand, Houston. I need you setting an example for the other girls not getting so damn...
*ALARM*
Looks like we're gonna have to test the repairs early.
@BATTLE
Enemy incoming! All hands to battle stations!
@BATTLE
More of the BF comin' in! Come on, boys and girls! Let's load those guns!
I need guns on that last cruiser, people!
Torpedo wake in the water to port!
Ah hell. Full ahead and swing us around to try and evade.
No! We'll muss the firing solution, Cap!
We can shoot them again after we...
Two more torpedoes, Captain! Submarine periscope spotted!
Helm, give me evasive maneuvers now!
Too late! Brace for impact!
*BOOM*
Everyone okay? Damage report!
Hong's unconscious, Captain!
Corpsman to the bridge! Someone figure out where that cruiser is.
She's running, Captain. The fleet's caught up, destroyer's chasing that sub off!
Houston... Ah, that's not a good look for you.
Just a little blood, Cap... I ah, feel a little dizzy.

Fields.MenuText: Goddamnit don't you get yourself hurt, I need you.
I'll admit, I didn't know Belles could bleed.
Should I start to evacuate the crew?

Fields.DialogueText: Ah'll be fine for it, Cap, just need a minute to catch my breath.
Might just be me, you know how we are... but when you take a body blow, you tend to bleed a bit.
Cap, I ain't too far gone that I can't smack you for that.
Sorry Cap, I need to... rest just a bit and focus on helping repairs.
The rest of you get to it! I want a full damage and casualty report - yesterday!
Cap, we're back in business.
Repairs fully completed? Excellent. It'll be good to get back to work.
Amen to that, Cap. I wanna give those jerks ten shades of hell for the trouble they've caused me.
So are we going to take this a bit more carefully from now on? You're no good to me dead.
I'm not much good to me dead neither, Cap, so don't you worry about it.

Fields.MenuText: That's the thing. I have to worry about it
Show me what you can do. I prefer your fighting spirit to having you passed out, getting blood and grease and sweat on my sheets.
I'd say you'll drive me to drink, but that's normal enough for both of us. Scotch while you're here?

Fields.DialogueText: Well it's me, Cap, and I'll make sure you ain't got much to fret over.
Whoa there, hon! Most folks'd be honored to have a pretty gal like me on their sheets.
I could go for a Dublin Dr. Pepper. Been checking some welds, so I'm hotter'n an erupting volcano.
Cap. I just got a weird feeling...
I know that face. Battle stations!
@BATTLE
Torpedoes in the water!
@BATTLE
Come on, now! Guns loaded!
Fire!
*BOOM*
Captain! They've slipped the fleet and are at full steam towards those islands.
That couldn't be a more obvious torpedo trap if there were neon signs advertising it.
So we're gonna chase them BFs down anyway, right?
Not this time, I'm not taking this ship, nevermind the fleet, into a battle ground they've picked.
That's not good enough!
Houston, with me, right now. XO, bring the fleet around, keep an eye on those islands. They might have subs come after us.
Aye-aye, Captain.
*HATCH SHUT*
You were wanting to see me in private... Captain?
What the hell's gotten into you? I appreciate not wanting them to escape, but hazarding the fleet is not sound tactics.

Fields.MenuText: I'm worried about you.
Don't you undermine my command on the bridge again. You got a problem you take it up with me in private, just like the XO or anyone else.
War's about bravado and caution... in equal measure. Sometimes you gotta pull back on the former.

Fields.DialogueText: No one asked ya to be worried bout me or anyone else.
Then don't you go making weird decisions! We coulda had them!
Sometimes you're a little too cautious, you hear?
I think you're starting to let the enemy get to you a bit.
You just get me in range of them Brujah, Cap, and I'll worry about myself.
Morganas dead ahead!
@BATTLE
Damage report?
Captain, they hulled us below the water line. We're taking on water, but Chief Connelly says he's got it contained.
Ain't nothing but a little scratch. We can pursue, Cap. I don't want them varmints escaping.
Casualties?
Light. No final count yet on wounded, but none dead. One of the compartments hit was unoccupied.
Captain!

Fields.MenuText: Let's focus on getting that hole patched and the injured crewmen to safety first.
Priorities, Houston.
Goddamnit, help me save lives, then we can go Morgana hunting all damn day.

Fields.DialogueText: They're gonna get away!
Priorities! Sinking the enemy's our priority, ain't it?
Ah... aye, Captain.
I'm going below to direct repairs and the medical teams. XO, you have the conn.
Wait, Cap! I'm coming too!
Battle stations, everyone! We ain't letting the Brujah get away this time!
@BATTLE
Dagnabit, Cap! We shoulda had them! These Brujah are more slippery than a greased hog.
That happens in a fight. We can't get'em all every time, much as I'd prefer it.
Then why don't we do it instead?

Fields.MenuText: Because my duty to the crew and the fleet comes first.
Because wandering into a fight is a good way to get us all killed.
It's not like we won't give them their share of shells and torpedoes soon enough. What's your hurry? Got a hot date?

Fields.DialogueText: Destroying the enemy's part of that duty, too!
You taking a shot at me? We've been okay so far!
Ah... that's... wouldn't you like to know!
Fine, fine, Cap, I'll try to drop my steam a bit... I just... I don't like knowing them Brujah are out there hurtin' folks.
I don't like it any more than you do, but we're no help to anyone if we're lying on the bottom.
Right... if you'll excuse me, Cap, I have... things to do.
Battle stations, everyone!
@BATTLE
Right, secure from battle stations. Nice job, people. I'll be in my ready room when the damage and casualty reports come in. XO, you have the conn.
Goddamn it all!
Close the hatch if you need to vent.
Aye, Captain... and why aren't you more upset?
About what? Light casualties, minimal damage, a battle group's worth of Moraganas driven away. Pretty solid day's work.
But their second group got away intact!
Ah, the small force of destroyers. They were heading towards another INPF fleet's AO. They've been given a heads up and will sweep up our table scraps.
It ain't right, Cap. It's ours to deal with.
Houston, this is a war, not a rodeo. In war, killing things is a team sport.
I know that. I just don't like anyone having to pick up our slack.
You're taking this personally, Houston. What's going on?
It's... it's nothing, Cap. I'll be fine.

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure? You can talk to me, Houston.
What's gotten into you lately?
I hope so, because we need you at your best.

Fields.DialogueText: It's... no, Cap, no need to worry yourself.
Ahm... it's nothing.
I'm always at my best, Cap, save for when the Shiner's run out.
I'll be in my quarters, Cap...
She seems different than normal... I should watch her closely for now.
*CLANG*
What the hell was that noise?
Houston was upset. She punched the bulkhead.
Hell's bells... figure out how to write that off as combat damage. Which way did she go?
Down and aft, Captain!
Right, I'll go after her.
I take it you're here to reprimand me?
No, I'm worried about you.
Ain'tcha the milk of human kindness... You can go. I'm fine.
You just dented a bulkhead hard enough that I'm going to pass it off as shell damage in our last engagement.
I'm just getting sick of sitting around and not getting in the fight, Cap. It's just who and what I am.

Fields.MenuText: It's not like you to get this frustrated.
Have you been drinking? It smells like a distillery over here.
Every part of our job is important, Houston.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe I've gone and changed. What's it to you?
What if I have? Little bit of beer ain't gonna kill a girl.
I consider this a waste of valuable military resources, Cap. My capabilities in particular.
I just need to clear my head. I'll be back in a little while, keep your shirt on.
Something's off here.
I'll figure it out. It's my job.
From the inside?
*ALARM*
Is that them? Is that the other group?
It's *a* group. Same job, Houston.
The hell it is.
@BATTLE
Morganas sighted off the port bow!
@BATTLE
Dammit, they slipped away again!
Houston, I appreciate that you're frustrated, but you're supposed to be helping me write this contact report for command.
Ain't you pissed, too, Cap? I'm madder n' a wet hen.
We'll get them eventually. They can't hide forever, but we can't overextend ourselves. Some of our repairs are patchwork as it is.
What's that matter? You think I can't handle it?
... You have bourbon on your breath.
So what if I do? You gonna tell command on me or something, Cap? I just need to take the edge off, is all.
I normally think of you as a beer drinker... a pretty passionate one, as anyone who's heard you preach the qualities of Texan beer can attest.
What's your point?
I haven't seen you drinking a beer in a while. I have seen you stealing nips out of that flask when you don't think anyone's looking.

Fields.MenuText: Houston, I'm worried about you, please. Let me help.
I'm starting to think there's more going on than you want to admit.
Houston... come on, now.

Fields.DialogueText: It ain't nothing, Cap. I'm fit as a fiddle.
... Maybe there is. Y'all wanna help, you help me send these Brujah back to hell.
I hate it when y'all look at me like that. Don't worry about it.
All we gotta do is complete this mission, and then I'll be back to my sparklin' normal self.
Heavy fog ahead!
@BATTLE
Damn, that flanking move's whip smart... they know that we're going to get out in front of the fleet.
Don't I know it... and if they manage to cut us off, we're going to be in deep trouble.
Wait... where's Houston?
She stormed off again right after we broke contact. Captain...
I know, I know..
I'm not sure you do, Captain. Houston's instability is starting to affect crew morale. Master at Arms says he's had to break up a couple of fights.

Fields.MenuText: Handle this quietly for now. Deal with the troublemakers, and don't bring this up to HQ just yet.
Goddamnit, and I'm getting pressed from HQ to push harder in this region.
I'm starting to get apprehensive about her.

Fields.DialogueText: Aye, Captain. I'll have it done.
I don't know if we'll be able to accomplish that, Captain.
The crew, too. Even if they lack the words for expressing it.
I think I'm going to need to have a talk with her.
That might be best, Captain.
Battle stations, everyone. We've got incoming!
@BATTLE
You wanted to see me, Cap?
I wouldn't mind it. Haven't seen you much recently.
I've... had things to do, Cap. A girl's gotta get to getting when she needs to.
I'm sure, but all the same. Houston, level with me, please. Your issues are my issues... and they're starting to affect the crew.
What in the hell are you on about, Cap?
You know exactly what I'm on about! Now answer me so I can help you!
She's taunting me, goddammit, and we can't kill her!
Her... you mean one of the Morganas in this region?
The one whose fleet keeps slipping us. That Brujah is making a fool outta me!
Not us, but you specifically... You're taking this personally, aren't you?
Damn right I am! I ain't gonna stand for this two-bit POS taunting me.
If you know she's taunting you, why are you letting her get under your skin? Come on! This isn't like you.
Maybe it is now.

Fields.MenuText: I don't think that's true, and I don't think you do either.
Houston, why won't you talk to me? You chose me, remember?
I'm not sure I can help if you won't let me.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, what would y'all know anyway?
... Maybe I don't want you to see it.
I... can't. You won't understand. You just help me put this Brujah down.
If that'll be all, Cap...
Cap... she's coming. I can feel her.
Right, one second... This is the Captain. Enemy contacts inbound. All hands to battle stations.
*ALARM*
You don't look happy. You were eager for a fight the other day.
I am... but I have a dark feeling about this.
Cap, I know I ain't exactly been the most stable Belle out here recently, but... don't let me go.

Fields.MenuText: Like you even have to ask.
Not now, not ever, even in the face of Armageddon.
Now you've got me spooked, but I won't. Let's make sure you don't have anywhere to go.

Fields.DialogueText: I thought you'd say that... still nice to hear it.
Now you're trying to make a girl blush.
All right... I'm ready, let's get to the bridge.
Let's go, Cap. I wanna show these Brujah who runs these waters.
@BATTLE
Morgana patrol coming in from the west!
@BATTLE
*BOOM*
Captain, that shot penetrated the belt armor!
I've lost the engines and rudder.
Report from damage control. We're taking on water in the engine compartment, serious flooding, but they should have it contained.
I'm okay, don't y'all worry too much...
Captain we're dead in the water, we'll be fine if we can get a tow but--
That won't matter if the fleet can't finish the engagement in time. Radio to the fleet, finish the mission then come back for us.
Aye, Captain, I'll pass the orders. You heard the Captain!
Hate to miss a fight... You think that one was my last? It's... *cough* it's not...
I know you want to throw a punch, but we have to sit for now.
We'll be back in the fight, right?

Fields.MenuText: Or we go to hell together.
We will. Stop jinxing it.
A captain always goes down with their ship. And a good one sees it come back up.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh... they'd kick us back out again for causing too much of a ruckus.
Is that an order, Captain? Heh... well all right.
A sunny outlook, Cap. I needed to hear that.
I wish I was like some of the other girls... that smarts somethin' fierce.
There's downsides for being as human as you are. But the beer makes it worth it.
I wish you'd just...
You're a bad liar, Houston.
I know, I know, you got my number by this point. I... don't want y'all to see me like this. All torn up and weak.
We had to take some hits, and we did. You can be weak with me now and then if you need it.
I don't know what to say to that right now... I'm... tired.
Don't say anything. Look, a flare from the fleet, our tow's inbound.
Good... I'll rest a minute, then.
You do that. Then we'll come back and really show them what we're made of.
Cap? Thanks for the sunshine. I'll be back in fightin' shape before you know.
Cap, I need to talk to you.
Well, take a seat. I'm all ears. Drink?
Nah, I'm not in the mood for alcohol.
You look pretty out of sorts. What's wrong?
I'd like to formally request that y'all dry dock me for a while.
What?!
You don't have to overreact, Cap... I almost got everyone killed.
What's going on in your head Houston? I'll take you off the battle line if you really want me to, but I need you to tell me everything.
It's... it's the fight. I've always been a brawler, but recently I've... been affected by it. Ain't scared or nothing, but... eager. Almost too much so.
Firing a well aimed broadside, my engines pounding, doing what I was born in fire and steel to do... but I've been craving it, and that ain't right.
Houston, you need to stay out here. Remember that we don't live to fight. We fight to live.
You've enjoyed life before, more than most people I've met. You eat, you drink, you play poker and the harmonica, you have talks with me on all manner of topics.
There's more in life to take joy from than combat... so cut yourself some slack. You're harder on yourself than anyone. You don't need to be.
Cap... sniff... I just... I'm scared. You're right, everything you've said is right, but there's... it's the Brujah, Cap.
I don't claim to know much about ‘em besides how to damage 'em, but... they're all one note, ain't they? Sabotage, Dismay, Corruption... maybe there's one out there called Bloodlust.
... Maybe I could be her.

Fields.MenuText: You think you could become a Morgana?
That sounds pretty far out there. Have you talked about it with anyone besides me?
That's a lot to think about... I try to focus on fighting, but I have to wonder what our enemy actually is sometimes.

Fields.DialogueText: I dunno if I can... it just... scares me Cap, an' fears ain't rational.
No... it's pretty recent and... I don't want to sound... weak.
They're whatever they are in the end, Cap... and so are we. Belles and humans alike.
I don't know about Belles and Morganas, but I know people. You need to get your mind off of it for a bit, and not let yourself get dragged under by this war.
Consider your request denied for now. Your new orders are to do something you enjoy. Alone, drag me along with you, whichever you prefer.
Aye, Captain... and thanks for listening.
Think you can handle one more?
I'll give it a damn good shot.
@BATTLE
We've got incoming!
@BATTLE
XO, I'm hearing a lot of noise.
Miss Houston decided to improve crew morale, so she put a spread of chow out in the mess and got some of the sailors to start up some music.
And at least two card games going on, if you fancy a hand, Captain.
I'll just make the sailors nervous if I'm around. I will go find our new Miss Morale Officer, though.
No sign of Houston in the mess... I thought she'd be in the thick of it. Hmm... maybe out here.
Hey, Cap, need something?
Just wanted to check on you. You're missing quite the party.
I was in there earlier and I had fun, but I decided to get some fresh air. Already boosted my own morale.
What about you, Cap? Gonna get yourself in there, and have a drink and some grub?
I'll snag a plate later. I'm where I want to be at the moment. Besides, having senior officers around puts a damper on festivities.
Well... if that's the case... music just changed to a two-step I like a fair bit. Mind joining me?

Fields.MenuText: My my, did you just ask me to dance? I might faint.
It'd be my pleasure, Houston.
You never struck me as the dancing type.

Fields.DialogueText: Aww, can it with the sass n' c'mere.
Well ain't you polite? Come on, I'll show ya how.
I'm full of surprises, hon. Thought you'd have known that by now.
Right, and step and step... You're picking up on this quick!
I'm still concerned about matching the rhythm of the enemy... They've got us all but hogtied.
We're off duty, you know. But it seems to me that if you're having problems with the rhythm, you need to change the song.
*SOME TIME LATER*
Great, more Morganas... Battle stations, everyone!
@BATTLE
Cap! I got something for y'all!
Houston, you're looking a lot better.
Bright-eyed and bushy-tailed, Cap. I quit drinking for a bit... it was hurtin' more than helpin'. I wanna enjoy beer, not need it.
Been hitting my Dublin Dr. Pepper stash a little harder, though, to keep me sharp.
Good to hear. So... ready to get back to work? Last I knew we had Morganas to sink in this area.
Damn right, an' I got me an idea on that... They've been faking us out.
They expect me to run out an' brawl with them. They've been using my... issues, so to say... so I say we turn it right ‘round on ‘em.

Fields.MenuText: That's gonna take a lot of planning.
Sounds like we're going to need intelligence to step up their game.
Let's do it then!

Fields.DialogueText: You know it, but... that's what I gotcha y'all round for, ain't it?
Might need give 'em a kick in the seat of their pants, Cap.
That's the spirit, Cap! Let's get'er done.
They mighta had me down and out, and I might not be 100% yet, but I am damn sick n' tired of these Brujah mucking up my ocean.
From your lips to the ears of whatever might be listening. Come on, let's get the XO and call in some of the other Belles for a radio conference.
Looks like we got a bunch of live wires headed our way. Battle stations, y'all!
@BATTLE
All right boys and girls, reel 'em in real nice now!
Three, two, one... hah! Perfect. Beautiful spread of torpedoes. My compliments to that destroyer and her crew. Pass my compliments to the gun crews as well.
Seems like we're firing on all cylinders, Cap. This will have 'em all riled up.
Good. If they stay angry, they might miss some of the fine details of the plan we cooked up.
Some fine work, if I do say so myself.

Fields.MenuText: So we've wiped out a of couple small groups, big fish next?
We need to resupply, but we should be ready for the next phase.
I haven't seen you in such a good mood in a while.

Fields.DialogueText: Yessiree, them big Brujah should be all sorts of stirred up now.
Let's make darn sure we got plenty o' food, fuel, and ammo before we hit the trail, Cap.
I ain't felt this good in a while, Cap!
Make sure y'all get the word out - this here's straight from the flagship n' the Captain! We're making this open season on Morganas!
Unlimited bag, no quarter.
As good as that line sounds... that's our normal engagement rules for Morganas.
You just let me have this one, Cap. I'm enjoying the chance to grandstand.
Morganas coming in for the bait. Battle stations!
@BATTLE
Houston, I was looking for you.
What's up, Cap? Something related to the mission? Did we get word on a Brujah formation?
Yes and no... What we have confirmed intelligence on is a pretty serious storm system coming through. It might throw a wrench in our plans.
From what I'm reading, our safest bet is to return to port and ride out the storm.
Cap, to risk sounding like I did recently, I don't think we rightly can pull back now. We need to see this through... and they'll like as not be suffering from the storm, too.

Fields.MenuText: I agree, and I've cut orders to that effect.
I'm not sure it's worth the risk.
If we're gonna take this risk, I want to pin these Morganas to the wall. I don't risk you girls or my sailors for nothing.

Fields.DialogueText: Thataway, Cap! Let's show them they've been shooting it out with the wrong rangers.
We'll make it worth the risk, Cap. We gotta pull through and get the information we need.
Roger that, Cap, I'll lock'em down for ya. You get the fleet ready to push through the storm.
They're gonna call us rough riders after this one, Cap, just you wait and see.
I'll certainly believe we're in for a rough ride, Houston, but I'm with you.
Damn straight, Cap. As long as we're together, the Brujah ain't got a chance in hell.
They're taking the bait! Battle stations!
@BATTLE
Captain, the last of the enemy contacts have been confirmed destroyed. Lookouts reported the storm front coming.
Don't even need to see it myself, I can feel it in my bones, Cap. This storm's gonna be a doozy.
Pass the order to the fleet - let's get everyone buttoned up. If you're going out on deck once the storm hits, you better have a damn good reason and a safety line.
I'll make sure the sailors know, Captain, and the radio room will get the fleet buttoned up.
Captain... where are we sailing to in all this? We need to set our course.
Morganas still where they're supposed to be, Houston?
You got it, Cap. They're gonna hit the storm round when we do.
Then we're heading right into the teeth of the storm. Keep the formation loose. I don't want anyone getting lost, but I don't want any collisions either.
Aye, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: How are you feeling?
Up for a wild ride?
Let's get through this bit so we can finish this fight.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm... better than I was, Cap. Dunno how long it'll be, but if I'm out of sorts you're my first port of call.
Cap, I'm always up to go for a wild ride with you.
Amen to that, Cap. Let's give'em hell and then some.
Steady as she goes, Helm.
Steady as she goes, aye, Captain.
Ahead full! Let's go right down the teeth of this gale.
Everyone's buttoned up and accounted for!
Good, be careful on your rounds. I'm glad I got my sea legs before this storm started.
Cap, we're coming through! How's your guts, not too bad from the storm?

Fields.MenuText: Oh, was there a storm? I didn't notice.
Has the deck leveled out at all? I swear we were vertical there for a minute.
Let's get down to business. Time to be seasick later.

Fields.DialogueText: You old salt dog. Let's get 'em, Cap.
Buck up, Cap! Rough seas make for good sailors, and we're all better sailors after that.
Right after my own heart, Cap. Let's get 'em!
Captain, scout plane has confirmed the location of the enemy fleet. They're still in disarray after the storm, and the pilot thinks they haven't been spotted.
Call them back. Sound general quarters.
*ALARM*
All right, Cap, here we go.
Gonna be a long fight, so make sure gunnery knows to pick their targets and not waste ammo. If we run out there's a lot of ocean between us and resupply.
We got this, Cap.
Captain, we're closing to range for the big guns!
All ships that have made range, open fire!
@BATTLE
Here they come, the Brujah bitches!
@BATTLE
Pour it on! Melt those gun barrels if you have to! I can take the heat, but the Brujah can't!
Get our fish in the water, Houston!
Torpedoes away! Running hot and straight...
*BOOM*
That's a hit! Captain, I think we broke her back!
Hah! That'll do it. Any other hostile contacts?
Nope, Cap! That's the last of'em. We got 'em good.
They took the bait perfectly.
I ain't sure I wanna play bait too often, but I'm glad we got 'em good this time.
I'd prefer not to either, I'd hate to lose my Belle.
Aww shucks, Cap. You gotta buy me a drink before you talk sappy like that.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, is that what it takes?
I seem to recall you getting pretty sappy sober now and then.
*winks*

Fields.DialogueText: Cap... you can't say that like that!
Now that ain't fair! A lady's allowed to wax philosophical from time to time.
Why you grinning like the cat that went and caught the canary?
Safe to say this was a job well done people. Secure from general quarters. I want fleet damage and casualty reports on my desk in thirty.
Y'all make sure you walk tall, chests out, chin up. We mighta had some rough times recently, but this here's something to be proud of.
They might be back, but they'll remember this whupping.
And we'll be right there to give them more of the same.
Cap, got a moment? I have beer and Dublin Dr. Pepper, if that's what's needed to bribe you to take a break.
I am highly susceptible to bribes of any nature when it comes to avoiding more of this damned paperwork.
I've been doing some thinking Cap, and I... wanna get this out there quick, then I'll get out of your hair.
I wasn't okay there for a while. Something you said stuck with me, and it's important to me now.
You said we all need someone we can be weak with. I might not be human, but you were right, I need that, too.
I'm glad you're someone I can be weak with, Captain. I don't think anyone else could ever be there for me like that.
Glad I found you. Couldn't ask for a better Captain, or a better...
Ah hell, I'm blushing so hard I might set your desk on fire. I probably need to go.

Fields.MenuText: Hold up a minute. Join me in the ward room tonight? I'm all out of dinner guests.
Don't rush off! You can always pull up a chair and help with this pile of paperwork.
Take your time to say what you need to say.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, I'd like that. Been eating alone a lot recently... it'd be good to join people for chow.
Cap, I feel indebted to you so much that I might do just that!
Not to worry, Cap, I'm learning to keep my pace again.
Cap, I'm still working myself out, and I'm still a bit of a mess... but thanks fer not giving up on me. I still got a lot going on in my head...
But when I sort myself out, you'll be the first person to know, sweetie. *kiss*
Well now this paperwork seems even less appealing than before... but at least I've got a dinner date.
